author: gstein
msg: * subversion/libsvn_wc/wc-metadata.sql: add some comments

author: hwright
msg: Merge r35466, r35712, r35713 from trunk:
Allow svn_mergeinfo_parse() to tolerate overlapping rangelists as input
while still guaranteeing the mergeinfo it creates has no overlapping
rangelists as required by all our rangelist manipulating APIs.
r35713 fixes a possible range shrinkage introduced in r35466. (r35712 is
a testcase for this issue).
Justification:
svnmerge-migrate-history.py and svnmerge-migrate-history-remotely.py
can create mergeinfo with overlapping rangelists, which breaks any
subcommand which encounters this mergeinfo because svn_mergeinfo_parse
returns a parsing error.
Note: Will conflict if r35297 group is not applied first.  Assuming
r35297 is already merged, accept theirs-conflict on
subversion\tests\libsvn_subr\mergeinfo-test.c to avoid a minor conflict.
Votes:
+1: rhuijben, pburba, gstein
[ Note: if this merge is reverted, the merge in r36128 should go too. ]

author: hwright
msg: Merge r35297, r35367 from trunk:
Allow svn_mergeinfo_parse() to tolerate unordered rangelists as input
while still guaranteeing the mergeinfo it creates has sorted rangelists
as required by all our rangelist manipulating APIs.
Justification:
Versions of svnmerge-migrate-history.py and
svnmerge-migrate-history-remotely.py prior to r35358 could create
mergeinfo in the repos with rangelists sorted in reverse order.
Prior to r35297 this broke any subcommand which encountered this
mergeinfo because svn_mergeinfo_parse returned a parsing error.
Votes:
+1: pburba, rhuijben
+1: gstein (as long as r35713 does not get vetoed out of the release)
